thread.title: International Expo-Science at Tour and Taxis
thread.title_full: International Expo-Science at Tour and Taxis

author: eTN Managing Editor
title: International Expo-Science at Tour and Taxis
text:
International Expo-Science at Tour and Taxis Adv: 
Jul 13, 2015 Adv: 
From the 19th to 25th of July 2015, at Tour & Taxis, the International Expo-Sciences will enable young people from around the globe to meet, exchange ideas, compare their projects or discoveries and develop their scientific, critical and creative mind. 
The International Expo-Sciences (commonly known as ESI), organized by the Youth Scientists of Belgium in collaboration with the Brussels-Capital Region, offers young participants a varied scientific and sociocultural program: 
- An exhibition of award-winning scientific or technological projects in the countries of the participants, presented by the young people themselves, - Numerous lectures to the participants, but also for the attention of visitors and partners. For example, a lecture by Professor and Nobel Prize in Physics 2014 François Englert or also a conference on "How to motivate young people to embrace scientific careers" animated by a panel of scientists, academics and public figures, - Visits to Mons2015 and Brussels through the Natural Sciences Museum of Belgium and the Parlamentarium, - The delivery of the Manneken Pis’ official costume for ESI 2015 - But also festive celebrations as the "Brussels Night" on the occasion of 21st of July. 
In Brussels, 1000 young people from 15 to 25 years from all continents, perhaps including some future Nobels’, will meet around 400 stalls of discoveries and innovations. The event is outlined as an inescapable of this July in Brussels, for families, friends, people with a keen interest in science or just curious ones.
